autodock_vina.description:
This function performs protein-ligand molecular docking using AutoDock Vina
on a Linux system. It handles preparation of receptor and ligand PDB files
into PDBQT format, configuration of the docking box, execution of Vina,
and extraction of the top-scoring pose.
autodock_vina.details:
The function performs the following steps:
\enumerate{
\item Prepares the receptor PDB file into PDBQT format using `prepare_receptor4.py` from MGLTools.
\item Prepares the ligand PDB file into PDBQT format using `prepare_ligand4.py` from MGLTools.
\item Estimates the docking box center (if not provided) by calculating the centroid of all protein atoms.
\item Writes a Vina configuration file.
\item Executes AutoDock Vina.
\item Parses the output to extract the top-scoring pose and saves it as a PDB file.
\item Saves the docking scores to a text file.
}
autodock_vina.examples:
#\dontrun{

# Using protein centroid as box center (not always recommended)
autodock_vina(
prot_pdb = "protein.pdb",
ligand_pdb = "ligand.pdb",
complex_pdb = "best_complex.pdb",
score_txt = "docking_scores.txt"
)
# Providing explicit box center coordinates (recommended)
autodock_vina(
prot_pdb = "protein.pdb",
ligand_pdb = "ligand.pdb",
center = c(10.5, 22.3, 18.7), # Coordinates based on known binding site
size = c(20, 20, 20),
exhaustiveness = 16,
cpu = 4
)

#}

parameters.name: prot_pdb
parameters.text: Character string. Path to the receptor protein PDB file.

parameters.name: ligand_pdb
parameters.text: Character string. Path to the ligand molecule PDB file.

parameters.name: complex_pdb
parameters.text: Character string. Output path for the top-scoring complex (PDB format). Default: './complex.pdb'

parameters.name: score_txt
parameters.text: Character string. Output path for the docking scores. Default: './score.txt'

parameters.name: center
parameters.text: Numeric vector of length 3. (x, y, z) coordinates for the center of the docking box in Angstroms. If NULL (default), the centroid of the protein is used. Providing explicit coordinates is strongly recommended for accurate docking[1,7](@ref).

parameters.name: size
parameters.text: Numeric vector of length 3. Size of the docking box in Angstroms (x, y, z dimensions). Default: c(25, 25, 25)

parameters.name: num_modes
parameters.text: Integer. Maximum number of binding modes to generate. Default: 10

parameters.name: energy_range
parameters.text: Numeric. Energy range (in kcal/mol) above the best mode to output. Default: 4

parameters.name: exhaustiveness
parameters.text: Integer. Exhaustiveness of the global search. Higher values may improve results but increase computation time. Typical range: 8-32[9](@ref). Default: 8

parameters.name: cpu
parameters.text: Integer. Number of CPU cores to use. Default: 1

parameters.name: seed
parameters.text: Integer. Random seed. Use for reproducible results. Default: NULL (uses Vina default)

parameters.name: mgltools_dir
parameters.text: Character string. Path to the MGLTools directory. Default: '/opt/mgltools'

parameters.name: autodock_vina_dir
parameters.text: Character string. Path to the AutoDock Vina directory. Default: '/opt/autodock'

parameters.name: make_cleanup
parameters.text: Logical. Should temporary files be removed after completion? Default: FALSE

autodock_vina.returns: Invisible NULL. The function writes two output files: the top-scoring complex structure (`complex_pdb`) and a text file containing docking scores (`score_txt`).
autodock_vina.title: Run Molecular Docking with AutoDock Vina

parameters.name: openbabel
parameters.text: the program file path to the ``obabel``.

smiles_2_pdb.returns: this function returns a plain text content data of the generated pdb structrue file data.
smiles_2_pdb.title: Convert the smiles structure information as pdb structure data

parameters.name: n
parameters.text: set the number of output predictions, (default to 10)

parameters.name: fixed
parameters.text: fix the receptor, preventing its rotation and switching with ligand during execution.

zdock.title: zdock workflow for docking two structure data
